message.content:
Step 1: Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio.
• From the balance sheet, the only liability is Current Liabilities – Taxes Payable = 727,140.68.
• The Total Assets at the end period are 29,133,140.32.
• Debt to Asset Ratio = Liabilities / Total Assets = 727,140.68 / 29,133,140.32 ≈ 0.02498, which rounds to 0.02.

Step 2: Calculate the Gross Profit Margin.
• From the income statement, Gross Profit = 4,142,813.42 and Total Revenue = 14,542,813.42.
• Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100 = (4,142,813.42 / 14,542,813.42) × 100 ≈ 28.49%, which we format as 28.50%.

Step 3: Calculate the Operating Cash Flow Ratio.
• From the cash flow, Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –17,417,367.15.
• From the balance sheet, Total Current Liabilities (Taxes Payable is the only liability) = 727,140.68.
• Operating Cash Flow Ratio = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities / Total Current Liabilities = –17,417,367.15 / 727,140.68 ≈ –23.956, which rounds to –23.96.

Thus, the final solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.02",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "28.50%",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-23.96"
  }
}
